===Etymology===
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=わきざし|脇|tr1=waki|t1=armpit, side of the torso|差|tr2=sashi|pos2=the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||continuative or stem form}} of verb {{ja-l|差す}} ''sasu'' “to insert, to stick into”}}, from the way the ''wakizashi'' would be stuck at one's side through the {{m|ja|帯|tr=obi||belt or sash}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> {{rendaku2|sort=わきざし|sashi|zashi}}

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|わきざし|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|わきざし}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=わきざし|weaponry}} a traditional Japanese [[shortsword]], often used as a [[secondary]] [[weapon]] to a [[katana]]
#: Traditionally 30cm to 60cm in length. For more details, see {{pedialite|Wakizashi}}

====Coordinate terms====
* {{ja-r|刀|かたな}}: traditional Japanese single-bladed curved [[sword]]
* {{ja-r|短刀|たんとう}}: traditional Japanese [[shortsword]] or [[dagger]] (30cm and shorter)
* {{ja-r|大小|だいしょう}}: “big and small”: the ''katana'' and ''wakizashi'' as a [[set]]

====See also====
* {{ja-r|鎧通し|よろいどうし}}: a kind of [[stout]] [[dagger]] intended for [[thrust]]ing
